poem:
"As Justice Turns Her Dial"

In marble hallways steeped in black-robed lore,
The chancellor's mace dances upon the scales,
Weighing golden truths, ever elusive, ever poor.
A lance of law in hand, Duncan Lewis assails.
Claiming rights in decline, like poets bemoan their art,
For whom justice is priced too high, no court will impart.
